entry.title: cvi_ledh mass fill object
entry.content:
hello

we are doing a conversion to S4Hana and in the CVI activities, we are running CVI_LEDH.

there are about 5000 customers/vendors that need harmonization but we already know that most addresses must be set to customer as well as for tax and leading bank to Vendor.

is there a way to mass set the object? it would be very time consuming to do this manually one by one

thanks for the reply

Alisa

entry.content:

entry.title: Dissertation Research ‚Äì Insights from SAP Supply Chain Professionals Needed
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I‚Äôm a postgraduate student in Msc in Procurement and Supply chain management from Griffith college Dublin, researching how digital tools like SAP impact supply chain operations. My dissertation focuses on how SAP influences cost control, decision-making, and efficiency across different industries.

I‚Äôve developed a short academic survey (approx. 5‚Äì7 minutes) to collect insights from professionals who work with SAP or in supply chain roles.

üëâ https://forms.office.com/e/YPXZ6ArcwD 

All responses are anonymous and used solely for academic research. I would be incredibly grateful for any input or feedback you can provide. Please feel free to share with others in your network who might be able to contribute.

Here is my email id: bhavya.alahari@student.griffith.ie  please feel free to ping me if there are any queries further or interested in knowing the results.

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Logic For Item in Grouping
entry.content:
I‚Äôve been assigned to modify a program where the requirement is to display Profit Center and its corresponding Profit Center Name, under specific conditions.

Business Rule:

Group the data by FI Document Number (BELNR) first, then apply logic to retrieve the correct Profit Center Name based on the Profit Center values within the same document group.

Scenarios:

Case 1:
If all Profit Centers in the group share the same first 4 digits, strip the remaining digits of trailing zeros and use that to retrieve the Profit Center Name.

Case 2:
If the Profit Centers share the same first 2 digits, strip the rest of the digits of trailing zeros and retrieve the Profit Center Name.

Case 3:
If the Profit Centers are completely identical, then directly retrieve the Profit Center Name using that value.

Issue I‚Äôm Facing:

Right now, the program logic is executed per line item, which means it cannot determine if Profit Centers within the same FI Document group are similar or different. Therefore, it's difficult to apply the rules above correctly at the group level.

I would appreciate any suggestions or advice on how best to restructure or enhance the logic ‚Äî especially how to compare Profit Center values across grouped FI Documents in ABAP, or whether you‚Äôve handled a similar requirement before.

Thank you in advance üôè

entry.title: How to know SAP license usage of my company?
entry.content:
Hi Experts 

In our company, we have procured 155 SAP licenses.  We have installed SAP ECC and S/4HANA (155 licenses ). 

Now I want to get a report about the remaining license count and usage of the existing licenses. 

Please advise.

BR 

Indka

entry.title: Business Partner details from CAMT EBS statements not correctly filled for Returns
entry.content:
Question about payment returns in CAMT Electronic Bank Statements. 


Our problem is that Business Partner details from CAMT statements filled with our own data, not data for real Business Partner. The root cause is that in SAP Standard transformation FIEB_CAMT053_V8_TO_FEB for these fields for Credit transaction (CdtDbtInd = CRDT) are filled from Debtor fields (Section: NtryDtls/TxDtls/RltdAgts/DbtrAgt). For payments it works correct. But for returns, our banks sends us statements with CdtDbtInd = CRDT and Business Partner information in Creditor fields (Section: NtryDtls/TxDtls/RltdAgts/CdtrAgt). So, one of these two (either SAP or our Bank) treats it not right. I'm trying to understand who? Would be appreciated for your advices, about how correctly it should be filled (in Debtor or Creditor section)? Is there any guidance in CAMT format description for specific processes (like returns)?

entry.title: Handling units with MTO: Sales order to be filled automatically MFHU
entry.content:
Hello guys, 

I want to configure the MTO scenario using Repetitve manufacturing and Handling units. I can create the HU in MFP1 and connect it to the sales order, te correct apcking instruction is determined. 

If I want to backflush the HU in MFHU, the field sales order is not automatically filled, I have to fill it again manually. 

Can you support me if I need to configure anything in the customizing so the sales order is automatically filled in MFHU backflush? 

 

Thanks

Felix

entry.title: Seeking Guidance on Growing
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I hope you're doing well. I recently graduated and have been working as a Data Migration Consultant for the past four months. I'm excited to be part of the SAP ecosystem and eager to learn and grow.

Looking ahead, I want to build a strong career and see myself at a higher professional level in the coming years. Since many of you have more experience in this field, I would really appreciate your advice.

  • What skills or certifications should I focus on?
  • Are there specific tools, modules, or projects I should try to get involved with?
  • How can I develop both technically and professionally in this role?

Any tips, resources, or personal experiences would be very helpful. Thank you in advance for your support

entry.title: Trading Partner within MM Subcontracting Consumption posting
entry.content:
Hello,

we face an issue in MM Subcontracting with an intercompany vendor. We use MM Subcontracting for a type of repair service. We send the broken item with a delivery related to a subcontracting purchase order, the item in the order is the same material number. When we receive the item back, the GR Posting also posts the consumption of the item sent (special stock in sending company) with trading partner. But this item is never owned by the IC vendor. Because of the system behaviour we get in trouble with our consolidation team, since this entry can not be consolidated with the IC vendor, so its a one side trading partner entry.

The propsal of SAP support is an implicit enhancement which we would like to avoid.

Has anybody a standard solution for this topic or maybe a process which does not cause such an issue?

Many thanks in advance!

Regards, Marion

entry.title: Migration from 0UC_ISU_24 to Recommended Alternatives ‚Äì Missing Fields Issue
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm currently working on migrating SAP IS-U DataSources to a BW/4HANA environment. The existing system is still running on BW on HANA. SAP provides a whitelist indicating which DataSources are considered obsolete and recommends suitable alternatives for BW/4HANA.

In our case, the DataSource 0UC_ISU_24 is actively used and business-critical. According to SAP‚Äôs guidance, the suggested replacements are 0UCCONTRACT_ATTR_2 and 0UCCONTRACTH_ATTR_2. However, we're running into a major issue: the recommended alternatives do not cover all the required fields. A significant number of fields are missing.

This seems to stem from the fact that 0UC_ISU_24 is based on a complex IS-U function module which pulls data from multiple tables, whereas the recommended replacements are far less comprehensive.

So here‚Äôs my question:
Has anyone dealt with this migration before and found a working solution?

  • Did you somehow reuse or copy the original extractor logic (e.g., Z-copy of the FM)?

  • Or is there another approach you'd recommend for getting all the necessary data into BW/4HANA?

Any experience, suggestion or direction would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Test environment does not display information on KE24
entry.content:
When executing the KE24 transaction it does not bring information.

After performing the homogeneous copy on June 10, 2025, transaction KE24 shows no information, but there is data at the table level. We don"t understand what"s happening or if something needs to be activated in the test environment. I clarify that transaction KE24 does work in the production environment; it displays information.

 

tables that display information:

CE1PA10, CE3PA10,CE4PA10, CE4PA10_ACCT,  CE4PA10_FLAG, TKEB, TKES, TKEZU,COEP
